title: Use a preliminary strategy
text: As there is a greatest common factor(4), factor it out. The expression should look like this: $$4\left(y^2-9y+12\right)$$.
speech: As there is a greatest common factor(4), factor it out. The expression should look like this:  4 times parentheses, y squared minus 9 y plus 12  .
pacedSpeech: As there is a greatest common factor(4), factor it out. The expression should look like this:   4 times , y squared minus 9 y plus 12

title: Identify
text: Inside the parentheses, is it a binomial, trinomial, or are there more than three terms? Since it is a trinomial with a coefficient of $$1$$, undo FOIL.
speech: Inside the parentheses, is it a binomial, trinomial, or are there more than three terms? Since it is a trinomial with a coefficient of  1 , undo FOIL.
pacedSpeech: Inside the parentheses, is it a binomial, trinomial, or are there more than three terms? Since it is a trinomial with a coefficient of   1

title: Use factors
text: Use the factors of $$12$$ to finish FOIL.
speech: Use the factors of  12  to finish FOIL.

title: Answer
speech: The answer is  4 times, parentheses y minus 2,  times, parentheses y minus 7,  .
pacedSpeech: The answer is   4 times,  y minus 2,  times,  y minus 7,
